question: The picture below shows a common soil organism. This organism is classified as:<image 1>
description: The image depicts an earthworm situated in a patch of dark, moist soil. The earthworm has a segmented body with a cylindrical shape, tapering slightly towards both ends. Its coloration is a mix of reddish-brown and pinkish hues, which are typical for earthworms. The worm appears to be actively burrowing or moving through the soil, as its body is partially submerged. Surrounding the earthworm are small green leaves, suggesting the presence of vegetation nearby. The texture of the soil looks rich and organic, indicative of a healthy environment suitable for earthworms. Earthworms are known to play a crucial role in soil aeration and nutrient cycling. They belong to the category of soil organisms that are relatively large and visible to the naked eye.
